At the time of the demonstrations, the Democracia real YA website had the support of over 500 diverse associations, whilst continuing to reject any collaboration from any [[political party]] or [[labour union]], defending the protestsâ independence from all institutionalised political ideology.

=== 15 May ===
+
===Timeline===
  +   +
==== 15 May ====
[[Image:Acampada BCN PlaÃ§a Catalunya.jpg|thumb|left|[[PlaÃ§a de Catalunya, Barcelona]], on 18 May]]
[[Image:Acampada BCN PlaÃ§a Catalunya.jpg|thumb|left|[[PlaÃ§a de Catalunya, Barcelona]], on 18 May]]
The first protest, on 15 May, was focused on opposition to what the protesters called "antisocial means in the hands of bankers", which referred to the changes Spain made in 2010 to contain the European financial crisis through bailout of the banks that society saw as responsible for the crisis, while at the same time announcing social program cutbacks. Protests took place in [[Madrid]], [[Barcelona]], [[Murcia]], [[Granada]], [[Malaga]], [[Santiago de Compostela]], [[Alicante]] and [[Valencia, Spain|Valencia]].<ref name="art2">{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/espana/manifestacion/indignados/reune/varios/miles/personas/toda/Espana/elpepuesp/20110515elpepunac_12/Tes |title=La manifestaciÃ³n de 'indignados' reÃºne a varios miles de personas en toda EspaÃ±a (''Outraged'' demonstration brings together several thousand people in Spain) |publisher=Elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
The first protest, on 15 May, was focused on opposition to what the protesters called "antisocial means in the hands of bankers", which referred to the changes Spain made in 2010 to contain the European financial crisis through bailout of the banks that society saw as responsible for the crisis, while at the same time announcing social program cutbacks. Protests took place in [[Madrid]], [[Barcelona]], [[Murcia]], [[Granada]], [[Malaga]], [[Santiago de Compostela]], [[Alicante]] and [[Valencia, Spain|Valencia]].<ref name="art2">{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/espana/manifestacion/indignados/reune/varios/miles/personas/toda/Espana/elpepuesp/20110515elpepunac_12/Tes |title=La manifestaciÃ³n de 'indignados' reÃºne a varios miles de personas en toda EspaÃ±a (''Outraged'' demonstration brings together several thousand people in Spain) |publisher=Elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
Line 52: Line 52:
In Granada, up to 5,000 protesters showed up, according to the newspaper ''Ideal''<ref>{{cite web|author=Juan Enrique GÃ³mez|url=http://www.ideal.es/granada/v/20110516/granada/personas-toman-calles-granada-20110516.html |title=5.000 personas toman las calles de Granada para exigir Â«democracia real, yaÂ». |publisher=Ideal.es |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref> and the protest took place without incident, except for an exchange of insults between some protesters and members of the Fraternity of the Virgin of Rosario, whose procession overlapped with the end of the protest after the latter had gone on longer than expected.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.ideal.es/granada/20110516/local/granada/democracia-real-ya-bronca-cruzarse-procesion-aurora-201105161109.html |title=Democracia Real Ya: Bronca al cruzarse con la procesiÃ³n de la Virgen del Rosario. Ideal |publisher=Ideal.es |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>

=== 16 May ===
+
==== 16 May ====
In [[Puerta del Sol]], protesters camped out during the night of 15 May; the campers were attacked during the early morning of 16 May.<ref name="art4" /><ref name="art6" /> Altercations took place in a variety of neighborhoods in Madrid, far from the pacifistic spirit of the protest, whose core group of protesters deplored these actions. The violent protesters destroyed public spaces, cut off traffic on [[Gran VÃ­a]] and confronted the police. 24 arrests <ref name="TV5">Informativos Telecinco; ''[http://www.telecinco.es/informativos/sociedad/noticia/100037814/La+manifestacion+de+Indignados+termina+con+24+detenidos+ La manifestaciÃ³n de 'Indignados' termina con 24 detenidos y cinco policÃ­as heridos]'', 16 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el 18 de mayo de 2011).</ref> took place along with 18 hearings and a few injuries, which in turn provoked a larger protest demanding their release.<ref name="art4" /><ref name="art6" /> They were finally released on bail.
In [[Puerta del Sol]], protesters camped out during the night of 15 May; the campers were attacked during the early morning of 16 May.<ref name="art4" /><ref name="art6" /> Altercations took place in a variety of neighborhoods in Madrid, far from the pacifistic spirit of the protest, whose core group of protesters deplored these actions. The violent protesters destroyed public spaces, cut off traffic on [[Gran VÃ­a]] and confronted the police. 24 arrests <ref name="TV5">Informativos Telecinco; ''[http://www.telecinco.es/informativos/sociedad/noticia/100037814/La+manifestacion+de+Indignados+termina+con+24+detenidos+ La manifestaciÃ³n de 'Indignados' termina con 24 detenidos y cinco policÃ­as heridos]'', 16 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el 18 de mayo de 2011).</ref> took place along with 18 hearings and a few injuries, which in turn provoked a larger protest demanding their release.<ref name="art4" /><ref name="art6" /> They were finally released on bail.
Various organisations, like ''[[Ecologists in Action]]'', publicly condemned the escalation of the protests caused by the police.<ref>Ecologistas en AcciÃ³n; ''[http://www.ecologistasenaccion.org/article20706.html Condena del levatamiento por la fuerza del Campamento de Sol]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el 18 de mayo de 2011).</ref>
Various organisations, like ''[[Ecologists in Action]]'', publicly condemned the escalation of the protests caused by the police.<ref>Ecologistas en AcciÃ³n; ''[http://www.ecologistasenaccion.org/article20706.html Condena del levatamiento por la fuerza del Campamento de Sol]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el 18 de mayo de 2011).</ref>

=== 17 May ===
+
==== 17 May ====
[[File:Acampada Sol ph03.jpg|thumb|right|17 May, at night in Puerta del Sol]]
[[File:Acampada Sol ph03.jpg|thumb|right|17 May, at night in Puerta del Sol]]
Large groups of demonstrators returned to protest in various cities, standing apart from the group in Madrid in [[Puerta del Sol]]. This time the protests were not called together by ''[[Â¡Democracia Real Ya!]]''.<ref name="art6" /> In a few cities, the police permitted the protesters to camp out, as took place in [[A CoruÃ±a]], where more than 1,000 people arrived on 15 May.<ref name="art4">La Voz de Galicia; ''[http://www.lavozdegalicia.es/espana/2011/05/17/00031305646837535184832.htm Varias acampadas reavivan las movilizaciones de Â«indignadosÂ» en Galicia]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref> In Madrid, about 200 protesters organized into an assembly, during which they decided to organize themselves for spending the night in Plaza del Sol, creating cleaning, communication, extension, materials and legal committees. Previously they had received a great deal of help from small businesses in the form of food.<ref name="art5">PÃ©rez-Lanzac, Carmen, de El PaÃ­s; ''[http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/17/actualidad/1305623988_837783.html Indignados y acampados]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref><ref name="art10" /> In the evening more than 12,000 people were gathered there.<ref name="art6">El Diario MontaÃ±Ã©s; ''[http://www.eldiariomontanes.es/rc/20110517/mas-actualidad/nacional/cientos-indignados-vuelven-tomar-201105172059.html Miles de 'indignados' vuelven a tomar la Puerta del Sol]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a)</ref>

Previously they had received a great deal of help from small businesses in the form of food.<ref name="art5">PÃ©rez-Lanzac, Carmen, de El PaÃ­s; ''[http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/17/actualidad/1305623988_837783.html Indignados y acampados]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref><ref name="art10" /> In the evening more than 12,000 people were gathered there.<ref name="art6">El Diario MontaÃ±Ã©s; ''[http://www.eldiariomontanes.es/rc/20110517/mas-actualidad/nacional/cientos-indignados-vuelven-tomar-201105172059.html Miles de 'indignados' vuelven a tomar la Puerta del Sol]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a)</ref>
Line 63: Line 63:
Protests and nighttime camp-outs took place in 30 cities.<ref name="art7">El Mundo; ''[http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2011/05/17/espana/1305649774.html Acampadas en cadena hasta el prÃ³ximo 22-M]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref> The protests gained the support of people in the [[United Kingdom]], who announced that they would sit outside of the Spanish embassy from 18 until 22 May.<ref name="art7" /> The protest in Plaza del Sol on the night of the 17 May consisted of about 4,000 people according to the authorities. 300 of them stayed until the dawn of 18 May.<ref name="art10">MuÃ±oz Lara, Aurora, de El PaÃ­s; ''[http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/16/actualidad/1305579962_497160.html El movimiento 15-M abarrota Sol]'', 18 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref>
Protests and nighttime camp-outs took place in 30 cities.<ref name="art7">El Mundo; ''[http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2011/05/17/espana/1305649774.html Acampadas en cadena hasta el prÃ³ximo 22-M]'', 17 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref> The protests gained the support of people in the [[United Kingdom]], who announced that they would sit outside of the Spanish embassy from 18 until 22 May.<ref name="art7" /> The protest in Plaza del Sol on the night of the 17 May consisted of about 4,000 people according to the authorities. 300 of them stayed until the dawn of 18 May.<ref name="art10">MuÃ±oz Lara, Aurora, de El PaÃ­s; ''[http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/16/actualidad/1305579962_497160.html El movimiento 15-M abarrota Sol]'', 18 de mayo de 2011 (consultado el mismo dÃ­a).</ref>

=== 18 May ===
+
==== 18 May ====
[[File:Acampada Sol ph18.jpg|thumb|right|Sol, May 18, early morning]]
[[File:Acampada Sol ph18.jpg|thumb|right|Sol, May 18, early morning]]
In Madrid, the protesters put up a large carp canopy beneath which they passed out signs with the intention of spending the night there between the 17 and 18 May. According to a reporter from ''[[El PaÃ­s]]'', many of them wore carnations, much as took place during the [[Carnation Revolution|Portuguese Carnation Revolution]]. In addition, they organized a food stand which provided food donated by local businesses and set up a [[webcam]] to provide news from Plaza del Sol through the website ''[[Ustream.tv]]''. The protesters were advised not to drink alcohol or to organize into groups of more than 20 people, as these acts could provoke a legal police crackdown.
In Madrid, the protesters put up a large carp canopy beneath which they passed out signs with the intention of spending the night there between the 17 and 18 May. According to a reporter from ''[[El PaÃ­s]]'', many of them wore carnations, much as took place during the [[Carnation Revolution|Portuguese Carnation Revolution]]. In addition, they organized a food stand which provided food donated by local businesses and set up a [[webcam]] to provide news from Plaza del Sol through the website ''[[Ustream.tv]]''. The protesters were advised not to drink alcohol or to organize into groups of more than 20 people, as these acts could provoke a legal police crackdown.

=== 20 May ===
+
==== 20 May ====
According to Britain's ''[[The Guardian]]'', "tens of thousands" had camped out in Madrid and throughout the country on the night of 19â20 May.<ref>{{cite web|author=Giles Tremlett in Madrid |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/may/20/spain-bans-protest-ahead-election?intcmp=239 |title=Spain bans young protesters ahead of elections|publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
According to Britain's ''[[The Guardian]]'', "tens of thousands" had camped out in Madrid and throughout the country on the night of 19â20 May.<ref>{{cite web|author=Giles Tremlett in Madrid |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/may/20/spain-bans-protest-ahead-election?intcmp=239 |title=Spain bans young protesters ahead of elections|publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
Line 103: Line 103:
At around 23:00, some 16,000 people (according to the police) and 19,000 (according to other sources) were gathered at and around Puerta del Sol.<ref>{{cite web|author=RTVE.es - MADRID  |url=http://www.rtve.es/noticias/20110518/minuto-minuto-manifestacion-acampada-movimiento-15/433335.shtml |title=Minuto a minuto: Los acampados debaten hoy el futuro del movimiento 15M tras las elecciones |publisher=RTVE.es |date=2011-05-18 |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>

=== 21 May ===
+
==== 21 May ====
In Madrid, Barcelona, Malaga and other cities 21 May started with a minute of silence followed by cheers and applause.<ref name="politica.elpais.com">{{cite web|url=http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/20/actualidad/1305920877_763863.html |title=El movimiento 15-M acamparÃ¡ una semana mÃ¡s en Sol | PolÃ­tica | EL PAÃS |publisher=Politica.elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref> Smaller cities, such as Granada, decided to start before midnight to avoid disturbing the neighbors. These protests occurred even though protests on the day before elections are banned.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.voanews.com/english/news/Thousand-Defy-Protest-Ban-to-Rally-Ahead-of-Spanish-Elections-122384549.html|title=Thousand Defy Protest Ban to Rally Ahead of Spanish Elections|publisher=Voice of America|date=21 May 2011|accessdate=21 May 2011}}</ref>
In Madrid, Barcelona, Malaga and other cities 21 May started with a minute of silence followed by cheers and applause.<ref name="politica.elpais.com">{{cite web|url=http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/20/actualidad/1305920877_763863.html |title=El movimiento 15-M acamparÃ¡ una semana mÃ¡s en Sol | PolÃ­tica | EL PAÃS |publisher=Politica.elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref> Smaller cities, such as Granada, decided to start before midnight to avoid disturbing the neighbors. These protests occurred even though protests on the day before elections are banned.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.voanews.com/english/news/Thousand-Defy-Protest-Ban-to-Rally-Ahead-of-Spanish-Elections-122384549.html|title=Thousand Defy Protest Ban to Rally Ahead of Spanish Elections|publisher=Voice of America|date=21 May 2011|accessdate=21 May 2011}}</ref>
Line 110: Line 110:
Other European cities had their own demonstrations, gathering 300 attendants in London, 500 in Amsterdam,<ref name="SPANISH WORKERS PUT CLASS BACK ON THE AGENDA">[http://radecon.blogspot.com/2011/05/spanish-workers-put-class-back-on.html].</ref> 600 in Brussels, 200 in Lisbon and some minor ones in Athens, Milan, Budapest, Tangiers, Paris, Berlin, Vienna and Rome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/20/actualidad/1305920877_763863.html |title=El movimiento 15-M acamparÃ¡ una semana mÃ¡s en Sol | PolÃ­tica | EL PAÃS |publisher=Politica.elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
Other European cities had their own demonstrations, gathering 300 attendants in London, 500 in Amsterdam,<ref name="SPANISH WORKERS PUT CLASS BACK ON THE AGENDA">[http://radecon.blogspot.com/2011/05/spanish-workers-put-class-back-on.html].</ref> 600 in Brussels, 200 in Lisbon and some minor ones in Athens, Milan, Budapest, Tangiers, Paris, Berlin, Vienna and Rome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://politica.elpais.com/politica/2011/05/20/actualidad/1305920877_763863.html |title=El movimiento 15-M acamparÃ¡ una semana mÃ¡s en Sol | PolÃ­tica | EL PAÃS |publisher=Politica.elpais.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>

=== 22 May ===
+
==== 22 May ====
Just after 14:00 on election day, the ''indignados'' that had gathered at Puerta del Sol announced they had voted to stay at least another week, until noon on 29 May.<ref>[http://www.rtve.es/noticias/20110522/indigandos-mantiene-camapadas-durante-jornada-electoral/433957.shtml RTVE: 'Los "indignados" de Sol deciden mantener las protestas al menos una semana mÃ¡s'] Retrieved 2011-05-22</ref>
